title: How do authors who narrate their own audiobooks get paid? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q: How do I get paid to narrate audiobooks? A: Once you’ve got your recording space and are comfortable with editing and mastering your recordings (unless you have someone to do that for you) sign up with either ACX or Findaway Voices. Fiverr is another place but they really push fast and cheap which isn’t very viable for all the effort that goes into voice work for books. Have Paypal set up or a bank account. Square is another possibility if you have external clients who are paying up front. Most of my audiobooks have been through ACX. One started there and then the rightsholder and I mutually agreed to migrate her book to Findaway instead. I have not gotten to poke around in that one with a narrator account yet, only rightsholder and self-narrator so far.

Send your demo tape to a audio book publisher. Hopefully they will say, Ahh! Yours is just the voice we need to read Our Next Exciting Title, and offer you a contract to record it. See my other answers re your choices of extracts for your demo recording. Good luck!
